 Other Ways to Give





Recognizing Our Donors

If CSUF students and faculty are the heart of our University, then donors are the backbone. The ways to make a difference are as diverse as our donors: scholarships; endowed chairs and professorships; special programs and centers; the building and renovation of facilities. We salute the many donors since our founding who have helped CSUF become the exceptional institution it is today, and invite you to join their distinguished ranks.
2020 Honor Roll   Ontiveros Legacy Society




Lifting Up Former Foster Youth"This amazing  Guardian Scholars program has changed, and quite possibly, saved my life,” says Jorge Cardenas.

Car Collection Fuels Scientific ResearchThe groundbreaking detection of gravitational waves prompted  Nicholas and Lee Begovich, to make one of the largest philanthropic investments in the history of Cal State Fullerton — a collection of 14 classic sports cars valued at $10 million.

Lifeline for Families in NeedCSUF’s Center for Healthy Neighborhoods  serves families living on an annual income of less than $25,000. The donor-supported center provides mental health services, career planning and development, leadership training, health and fitness classes, parenting workshops, academic and art programs for youth.

Great Returns on a Titan InvestmentWith visionary support Jeffrey Van Harte ’80 launched  Titan Capital Management which provides students with hands-on investing experience.

Web Accessibility

			CSUF is committed to ensuring equal accessibility to our users.  Let us know about any accessibility problems you encounter using this website.
			We'll do our best to improve things and get you the information you need.
